Don't love your job?  I hear you.  But trust me -- don't quit.  At least, 99% of you shouldn't.

Most jobs in tech aren't as rewarding as we'd hoped.  In the end, being an FDE is endless deployments.  A mid-level PM working on yet another update to an agent?  Yawn.  Selling the same product to an ever shrinking patch in sales may not be that great.

But the honest truth is every B2B CEO I know:

- Wants to get even leaner
- Doesn't think half their team is the right one for Age of AI
- Wants to backfill departures with AI

Before you quit, before you take off, just make sure there's a decent chance there's somewhere else to actually land.

Note this tweet well. @antonosika is kindly sharing what vibe coding is really being used for today, top 4 use cases ‚Ä¶ 

Rapid prototyping of apps without taxing engineering is #1 use cases.  The killer use case today.

Building simple B2B apps is #4.  Simple ones.

https://t.co/PBv85S5Cyt is back May 12-14 in the SF Bay Area ‚Äî and this year, it's all about AI and AI Agents transforming B2B!

We're well past the hype cycle. The founders and leaders coming aren't talking about what AI might do someday. They're showing what it's already doing to their revenue, their teams, and their products right now.

You'll hear from founders who've gone AI-native and are growing 3x, 5x, even 10x faster than their competitors. Leaders who've deployed AI agents across sales, support, onboarding, and ops ‚Äî and have the metrics to prove it works. CEOs who've completely rearchitected their companies around AI and came out the other side with better margins, faster growth, and smaller teams doing more than ever.

We're talking:

‚Üí How the best AI-native B2B companies are actually building and selling today
‚Üí Real demos of AI agents replacing entire workflows, not just summarizing emails
‚Üí What's working in AI pricing, AI-led go-to-market, and AI-first customer success
‚Üí How founders are competing when AI agents are disrupting their own categories
‚Üí The metrics that matter when your "team" is 3 humans and 20 AI agents

At SaaStr, we've lived this ourselves. We replaced most of our team with AI agents, went from -19% growth to +47%, and built AI tools that have been used over 750,000 times. So this isn't theory for us. It's how we run the business every day.

Whether you're a founder trying to figure out where AI agents fit in your product, a revenue leader rethinking your GTM with AI, or an operator looking to 10x output without 10x headcount ‚Äî this is the one event you need to be at this year.

10,000+ B2B + AI founders, operators, and investors. Three days. The SF Bay Area.

https://t.co/PBv85S5Cyt 2026
Meanwhile I was having lunch
Gonna be BIG

RUN THIS PROMPT IN CLAWDBOT TO GET OPUS 4.6 RUNNING

By default, Opus 4.6 is not supported by ClawdBot/OpenClaw.

You need to do some manually hacking to get it to work. For my setup, this prompt worked for me

Since we might be on different versions, paste this prompt down below into your Clawd and say "this prompt should help you upgrade to Opus 4.6. Check it over first to make sure it's compatible with our setup and won't break anything. Back up our config file"

Here is the full prompt:

Upgrade me to Claude Opus 4.6. Follow these steps exactly:

Find the model catalog file:

find /opt/homebrew/lib/node_modules/clawdbot -name "models.generated.js" -path "*pi-ai*"
(On Linux, check¬†/usr/lib/node_modules/clawdbot¬†instead)
In that file, find¬†"claude-opus-4-5". There are¬†two¬†entries (one with¬†provider: "anthropic", one with¬†provider: "opencode"). Add this block¬†above each one, matching the provider field to whatever the 4.5 entry below it uses:

"claude-opus-4-6": {
    id: "claude-opus-4-6",
    name: "Claude Opus 4.6 (latest)",
    api: "anthropic-messages",
    provider: "anthropic",
    baseUrl: "<https://t.co/G6axlxLkaj>",
    reasoning: true,
    input: ["text", "image"],
    cost: { input: 5, output: 25, cacheRead: 0.5, cacheWrite: 6.25 },
    contextWindow: 200000,
    maxTokens: 64000,
},

Patch the config:Use¬†gateway config.patch¬†with:¬†{"agents":{"defaults":{"model":{"primary":"anthropic/claude-opus-4-6"},"models":{"anthropic/claude-opus-4-6":{"alias":"opus"}}}}}

IMPORTANT:¬†The config patch does a hot reload which won't pick up the catalog change. You need a full cold restart. Run:¬†clawdbot gateway stop && clawdbot gateway start
After restart, verify with¬†session_status¬†that you're running on¬†claude-opus-4-6.

Drop what you are doing

It happened. Opus 4.6 is out. 

This is what you need to do immediately if you want to escape the permanent underclass:

‚Ä¢ Upgrade your ClawdBot to Opus 4.6 NOW
‚Ä¢ Test out the new 'agent swarms' in Claude Code. Give more complex tasks than you normally do and watch how it spins up multiple agents
‚Ä¢ Give ClawdBot/Claude Code larger tasks. You now have a million token context window to play with. This means WAYYYY larger memory
‚Ä¢ Test out agentic search: have your ClawdBot scout the web. Ask it to find trends on Reddit you can make apps about

When new tech drops, you have to take advantage of it. That's the only way to win

Put your phone on Do Not Disturb and get to it
if you're not technical and want to try openclaw, this is the easiest way:
unpopular opinion: moltbot was a better name

Unpopular opinion: chatbots are actually making us slower.

Every AI tool right now works the same way.

One model. One conversation. One task at a time.

You babysit it through every step like a junior employee who needs hand-holding on everything.

We've been settling for AI assistants when we should be commanding AI teams.

I've been testing @Spine_AI and it broke something in my brain.
You give it a goal and a swarm of specialized agents spins up automatically.
One researches. One plans. one executes. One cross-checks the others for errors.

All of it happening simultaneously on a visual canvas you can watch and control in real-time.

300+ models working together. Not one chatbot pretending to be smart.
The cross-checking alone is wild. Agents validating each other's outputs means hallucinations get caught before they reach you. Not after you've already built on top of bad information.

No terminal. No code. No black box.

You're not managing a conversation anymore. You're managing an AI army.

This is built for people who do complex, multi-step work for a living.
Strategists, researchers, analysts, ops leads. The thinkers.

I don't hype tools often. But if their swarm intelligence roadmap lands the way the early version suggests, single-model chatbots are going to feel primitive within a year.

The Spine Swarm waitlist just opened. Spots are limited.

Grab yours. Link in the comments.

#SpineAI #AIAgents

One of my biggest flaws is I don‚Äôt show gratitude enough. I get caught in the moment and let excitement, stress, obsession take over too often. 

But today I‚Äôm feeling really grateful. I want to thank anyone who‚Äôs been following and supporting me for the past 3 years. I‚Äôve gotten to be a ‚Äúcontent creator‚Äù and now startup founder in the coolest period of technology ever. 

I really really enjoy what I do, and I love more than anything making videos that provide value to people. And I‚Äôm so happy that a big part of my role as a founder is to continue making valuable videos for people on x, yt, IG and TikTok.

It‚Äôs fun for me. It energizes me. I‚Äôll never stop.
